TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed OpenShare extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates how to open a file when calling file-access functions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you call file accessâ€“related functions, you can use enumeration members in your code in place of the actual values.
The `OpenShare` enumeration defines constants that specify whether or not other processes can access the file while your application has it open. The following table lists the `OpenShare` enumeration members.
When performing file I/O operations, the `My.Computer.FileSystem` object provides greater performance and ease of use than legacy file I/O methods. For more information, see <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.OpenShare Default = int32(-1)
.field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.OpenShare LockRead = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Other processes cannot read the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.OpenShare LockReadWrite = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Other processes cannot read or write to the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.OpenShare LockWrite = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Other processes cannot write to the file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.OpenShare Shared = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Any process can read or write to the file.
